The newest updates still had bug. Since Evernote update version 8.2 above, cannot send/share image through Whatsapp, and cannot open the image sent . Please fix. Thank You

Never use this for storing sensitive information. This is always accessed by hackers as well as its own employees seeking for ur data. I have got a message of paying dollars for my own data allegedly hacked by someone through this app.

This is the first time I wrote a review for an app. I am Android developer and really amazed about what you done guys but can you please enhance image processing for handwriting it's hard sometimes to capture notes. love you Evernote
It is a good app but i cant write in arabic from right to left.. It forces me to right from left to right like English.. I hope to fix this issue and it will be 5 stars app. Ty.
Incredible app. Use it constantly. Great for organization, and for creating and working on projects over time

Evernotes been ok since I started using it 2 or 3 years back but it has suddenly decided to go completely buggy on me today. I'm unable to create new notes, edit old ones. Neither is it allowing me to edit /create (keeps stalling, freezing) not does it save when you try to exit a note. I just lost a...Full ReviewEvernotes been ok since I started using it 2 or 3 years back but it has suddenly decided to go completely buggy on me today. I'm unable to create new notes, edit old ones. Neither is it allowing me to edit /create (keeps stalling, freezing) not does it save when you try to exit a note. I just lost an important note to this. My attempt to uninstall and reinstall doesn't seem to have yielded much either. It was working just fine till two hours back. I'm using a Realme X phone. Kindly help plz
Best app for organizing your schedules and notes. But high price for premium features.

I think I might be done with evernote and looking for an alternative. It has always been very okay--even with a paid subscription. It was the only option. But I've had a problem the entire time I've used it. If I use evernote across all of my devices (the only reason I use it) it constantly happens ...Full ReviewI think I might be done with evernote and looking for an alternative. It has always been very okay--even with a paid subscription. It was the only option. But I've had a problem the entire time I've used it. If I use evernote across all of my devices (the only reason I use it) it constantly happens that an older version of a note on one device will sync as the most recent version, even though that device hasn't been synced in days. I lose days of information. If I have it on my computer and I didn't close it out and my computer is in sleep mode for a weekend and I've been using it on my phone throughout the weekend and I return to the computer and wake it up, that version of the notes syncs up and screws me out of the entire weekend's worth of data and updates. What kind of idiot programming allows it to think a note that hasn't been updated in two days on one device should override a note that has been constant use on another device. And why hasn't this been issue been dealt with after lord knows how many years evernote has been going. If your data is important and you are a regular user. Look for something else. I am. I'm so fed up I could spit. While I'm at it. The formatting is a crazy person. I can change the formatting for the whole note and then I'll delete a line and the formatting for everything after that will revert back to a previous formatting. Sometimes I'll be making a list and every line will be a larger font. It's seriously like the damn thing is drunk. It doesn't matter what device I use. It has always been an idiosyncracy I put up with because I didn't want to have to find something better.

It used to be the best note taking app but then they introduced a limitation that has software glitches - theoretically you can have up to 2 devices using the free plan; however, in practice it's not only devices but browsers count as well so you can easily lock yourself out of your account and cann...Full ReviewIt used to be the best note taking app but then they introduced a limitation that has software glitches - theoretically you can have up to 2 devices using the free plan; however, in practice it's not only devices but browsers count as well so you can easily lock yourself out of your account and cannot access your data anymore (!) unless you pay for premium subscription. They have no support contact (or at least I have not found it yet); the free version became unusable.

This used to be my favorite writing app. But my old phone conked out and I had to wait awhile to get a new one. Upon signing in to my device it prompted me to unsync my other phone. Okay makes sense. I do that and EVERYTHING has been deleted. I'm sincerely heartbroken from losing all the stuff I had...Full ReviewThis used to be my favorite writing app. But my old phone conked out and I had to wait awhile to get a new one. Upon signing in to my device it prompted me to unsync my other phone. Okay makes sense. I do that and EVERYTHING has been deleted. I'm sincerely heartbroken from losing all the stuff I had on there. I get that I can't really about it since it's "free", but I'm still upset..

Pros: jam packed with a lot of features and can be synced across multiple devices and operating systems for free. Cons: It is VERY glitchy! I have lost a full note multiple times due to glitches. Sometimes it says it's a duplicate error, other times it just deletes the whole note on me while I'm sti...Full ReviewPros: jam packed with a lot of features and can be synced across multiple devices and operating systems for free. Cons: It is VERY glitchy! I have lost a full note multiple times due to glitches. Sometimes it says it's a duplicate error, other times it just deletes the whole note on me while I'm still typing it. I use it as a bridge between MAC and Android. My preference is iCloud notes because of how it "just works". Evernote does not "just work" in the way I wish it did.

It's like digital and a virtual workspace. There are some MAJOR flaws, if you have multiple businesses or personal account and business account, it is very grueling to switch between accounts, you will have to upgrade to premium very quickly. even if you upgrade to premium, it looks like you need to...Full ReviewIt's like digital and a virtual workspace. There are some MAJOR flaws, if you have multiple businesses or personal account and business account, it is very grueling to switch between accounts, you will have to upgrade to premium very quickly. even if you upgrade to premium, it looks like you need to have premium for all of your accounts in order to switch back and forth and do more fluid sharing, which is outrageous $200+ per year. Evernote, FIX THIS YESTERDAY.

I love the fact that I can keep synced notes between my Web browser and my android phone. However for the last month syncing to Web has been unsuccessful, so I have had to down grade my review from 4 to 3 stars. I have tried all your normal tips. Nothinf works. My Web notes are no longer syncing to ...Full ReviewI love the fact that I can keep synced notes between my Web browser and my android phone. However for the last month syncing to Web has been unsuccessful, so I have had to down grade my review from 4 to 3 stars. I have tried all your normal tips. Nothinf works. My Web notes are no longer syncing to my phone... I hate it, and am now considering changing to another note system... A Shane after 9 years as a loyal customer and ambassador ti Evernote.

This app is not as good as other note keepers that I've used. The interface is clunky and not intuitive. Also when using shared notes, if you are revoked access or the shared note is deleted, it still shows up with no way to delete or remove from view (can't do it on web either). This is aggravating...Full ReviewThis app is not as good as other note keepers that I've used. The interface is clunky and not intuitive. Also when using shared notes, if you are revoked access or the shared note is deleted, it still shows up with no way to delete or remove from view (can't do it on web either). This is aggravating if you are using this app to keep organized. Also you cannot contact support unless you have an upgraded account. And the FAQ page is lacking. Overall many improvements needed for me to keep using...

Great for quick notes, love that it sinks over multiple devicesand and i really appreciate the dark theme feature.

One of the best apps out there. I use it for almost everything. My life has become much more organized, and frankly, remembered as well. It's my to-do list, place to brainstorm, collection of notebooks, saved documents, personal diary and external memory all at the same time. All with options to kee...Full ReviewOne of the best apps out there. I use it for almost everything. My life has become much more organized, and frankly, remembered as well. It's my to-do list, place to brainstorm, collection of notebooks, saved documents, personal diary and external memory all at the same time. All with options to keep it orderly and easy to find. Thanks, Evernote! Please keep up the good work.

I'm so dissapointed with Evernote. I have used the free app, as I only need the basic features. I signed when the app was free and never intented to pay for using it, Through Google account Evernote charged my account with nearly $90 without my consent or agreement. I sent an email immediately, but ...Full ReviewI'm so dissapointed with Evernote. I have used the free app, as I only need the basic features. I signed when the app was free and never intented to pay for using it, Through Google account Evernote charged my account with nearly $90 without my consent or agreement. I sent an email immediately, but I haven't received any communication. I'm hoping to get my money back as soon as possible.

One of the more useful apps, but I feel I was backed into a corner to pay for use on multiple devices. There, I said it. I rarely use it on devices other than my phone, but I like the option. Gut reaction when they did it, and haven't gotten over it, probably since I'm reminded each month.

Pretty unreliable for taking notes if you're offline. Tapping on the add note opens the new note page but I can't start typing down notes anyway. I love this app for creating notes. It is easy to copy and paste between this app and others such as messages, email, and Facebook, but I don't like that I can't share the file to my computer. Revised -- I gave you another star since I was able to install Evernote on my desktop :-)

Don't install this app! It is the worst app ever! It crashes all the time! The font becomes huge when you paste text into it. You can't change font size, color, etc, only zoom available. You can't copy, move, delete groups of notes, unless you install it in Windows 10, but then you must carry a PC a...Full ReviewDon't install this app! It is the worst app ever! It crashes all the time! The font becomes huge when you paste text into it. You can't change font size, color, etc, only zoom available. You can't copy, move, delete groups of notes, unless you install it in Windows 10, but then you must carry a PC along with your phone, which is not sensible. Your personal data is constantly at risk. They really shouldn't charge anything for this amateur app.

This is probably my favorite app! I have used it to plan weddings and decorate houses. Wherever I go, the information is always with me. When creating a shopping list you can group items by aisle on your computer and when you get to the grocery store, the list is on your phone! I have been recommending it to all of my friends for the last ten years.

In general it's a very good app for saving all sorts of content. The only thing that bothers me is how slow the app seems to perform at times, even when I just restarted my phone. Also, the space limit is restrictive, so maybe try to just save text notes there.

Evernote is an invaluable complement to my Sony Reader. I can save selected passages from ebooks directly to Evernote from my Sony ebook reader, add my own remarks and upload both via WiFi from anywhere. I am always impressed later, much later usually, when I browse my saved book comments, precious ...Full ReviewEvernote is an invaluable complement to my Sony Reader. I can save selected passages from ebooks directly to Evernote from my Sony ebook reader, add my own remarks and upload both via WiFi from anywhere. I am always impressed later, much later usually, when I browse my saved book comments, precious  insights of a forgotten moment, now refreshed while reading my own thoughts, insights captured long ago in Evernote. It's so edifying.

Love the app. I would like to get the premium version but I don't think I would use it enough to warrant paying monthly or $26.00 a year. I got Diaro pro for a one time 6.97. it works with Evernote so that's pretty much the only time I need it

Great app by and large, just in need of some more modern features (collapsible lists for one) and a little bit better reliability with sync, as sync issues still occasionally cause lost entries, and as a platform I use for work, that's huge. For personal use its great. I see other reviews which are mixed when using it for business. But a note that you can log in to anywhere for personal use allows me to manage my collection inventories anywhere on the go. Great app.

Pathetic on Android phone. Whenever editing the notes it get locked automatically. And not syncing

2020-03-15 v8.13 - insert line bug is fixed!!! Note Upload bug still there. OLD -Ver 8.12.1 installed today. Still the issue with the horizontal line inserting at the END of the note, not at the cursor position. This has been an issue since the update in June 2019. I have been using Evernote for about 5 years now, and it is the best for keeping any thoughts or lists I want to note down for later. It sounds basic but I realise how essential it is everytime I upgrade my phone, thank goodness it transfers everything when you log in on your new phone.

It's a fairly good app . I just don't like the way they sort the notes. Would love if they added a calender feature so we can sort of use evernote to add data entries for a specific date if we want. Just way easier that way.

One of the best note taking apps. The only problem is that it will always prompt conflict when we try opening any notes that has been edited through PC. The sync between phone and PC is not satisfactory. . Password option to open the app and dark mode are features that are well appreciated
The earlier version was good. Right now, this app shows different contents for a note when you try to open it. It also crashes when I try to edit my longest note.

Not bad. Just keep it updated. Couldn't access my notes for the last several weeks. Went to Playstore to post review and saw an update available. Problem solved. Poor communication of need to update and consequences for not updating. Really frustrating.

Flexible - I can drop in images, web links, take photos of when notes or printed materials. And all of it is searchable. Evernote is my go-to place to keep all the info I need to store, organize, and access.
Been using Evernote for years & it has been generally trouble free. Now it's locking up & won't allow me to cut & paste from other websites. Seems like the latest update is buggy.

Awesome app, tried Trello, ToDo list and other apps. I find Evernote easy to use, seamless in integration, like emails, sync across devices, capture images, journalling and tracking, etc. Added to that, decent templates for productivity, Habit tracking, goal setting, checklists- makes life easy..

Been really a great help in organizing things and would also love to have the ability to change thumbnails for a specific note since I require to set specific images in notes where they contain similar images. Thank you for the great satisfactory application
Very easy to use and organize your entire life... Plus you can access it from any device. No ads and totally free. Perfect note taking app.

As of today, a few seconds after I opened the app it takes me to an upgrade screen and says I have to purchase premium. I have to work from home because of covid-19 and need my notes, and now Evernote is making me spend money? Great timing.

Essential app to organize your life. I use it everyday to journal, plan my day, write down ideas, write about my past, store important documents and whatever I'm sure that I can get done with Evernote first.

This is a great app, but it's lacking one of the most important features. You have to pick from one of Evernote's options ... by creation date, updated date, alp...Full ReviewThis is a great app, but it's lacking one of the most important features. It shouldn't even be called a feature, it should just be a standard part of the app. There is no way to manually sort notes and notebooks. You have to pick from one of Evernote's options ... by creation date, updated date, alphabetical order, etc. Many people have requested this and have discovered workarounds, but it should be something that the app just does. It's such a no-brainer for a note taking, productivity app. I keep getting bugged to upgrade to the paid version, but they totally ignore the most requested function of the app, so why would I pay for it? Even though it's a great app otherwise, it gets one star for that single reason.

All other notes apps pale in comparison including one called OneNote It's sad that Evernote has been in the news for wrong reasons and the company is struggling with high profile departures etc. But what it has done for Note taking is legendary. For sensitive details, I recommend using a local notebook (not one that can be seen on multiple devices), and maintain y...Full ReviewI have used Evernote for a long time - as a journal, as a project holder, as a brainstorming tool. Great spot for bringing together small details so you can see "the big picture". For sensitive details, I recommend using a local notebook (not one that can be seen on multiple devices), and maintain your own back up of that notebook. This way, you have complete control over the details, while being able to enjoy the super fast search capabilities of Evernote. Biggest negative: Evernote features are not consistently available on all platforms... examples: vertical line; seeing tags as you view your notes; control of type size while inputting your notes; app behavior for sync; use of template feature. If you can live with learning the "core" features of Evernote, and accept what is missing on certain OS platforms, I consider my Evernote premium subscription a bargain.

Beautifully crafted and easy to use. But unreliable. I lost hours of work in different occasions because I had closed the wrong browser tab. It simply does not sync well with the server, does not saves your notes consistently. I left for Google drive in the middle of a fully-paid year.

I highly recommend it, I also highly recommend getting rid of your iPhone since they care so little about your data.

I swapped to Evernote from Onenote after switching to a Chromebook and being thoroughly dissappointed with Microsoft's android application. That being said, this app has much better support for Andoird however the support for Chromebook is so-so. The app relies on your device's keyboard autocorrect ...Full ReviewI swapped to Evernote from Onenote after switching to a Chromebook and being thoroughly dissappointed with Microsoft's android application. That being said, this app has much better support for Andoird however the support for Chromebook is so-so. The app relies on your device's keyboard autocorrect features, which is great....for phones. My chromebook has a physical keyboard and thus doesn't have autocorrect built in. It is annoying to be reading through my notes and having to also spell check everything at the same time. The drawing feature is basic, but okay. After clicking the drawing icon it opens up a new page for your drawings, and once finished will simply "paste" the entire large picture under your notes. It would be nice if I could just annotate my notes and draw small diagrams next to, or between, paragraphs of text notes. I assume this is related to the lack of Chromebook support as that would be difficult to accomplish on a phone. You have the ability to add in photos from your gallery or dowloads into notes, which is awesome in addition to my Chromebooks "snippet" feature, however you can NOT resize the image from within the app. You must open the image seperately, edit the sizing of the photo (guessing on how it will fit in your notes) and then REIMPORT the image to the notes. This is annoying and frustrating. All in all, this app is not bad and gets the job I need done better than Microsoft (on android) but lacks support for Chromebook. Improve Chromebook support and I will happily raise my rating of this app.

Each for a different reason....Full ReviewI've had evernote since 2011 (8 years). I still have notes from 8 years ago, completely untouched. They're like a portal to the past, showing how far I've come and how my mind used to work as a teenager compared to now as an adult. Since 2011 I've created over 150 notes! Each for a different reason. With this app I'm not just able to store memories, but can organise my entire life. Through writing lists, daily planning, random thoughts and short stories I have stored a piece of myself forever.
